perturbation.original_text: "Intellectual Property Rights" or "IPR" means any and all intellectual property rights existing anywhere in the world associated with any and all (i) Patents, (ii) Trademarks, (iii) Copyrights, (iv) Domain Names, (v) rights in Technology, (vi) rights in Trade Secrets, (vii) rights in Data, (viii) all tangible embodiments of the foregoing in whatever form or medium and (ix) any other legal protections and rights related to any of the foregoing. "Intellectual Property Rights" specifically excludes contractual rights (including license grants from third parties).
perturbation.changed_text: "Intellectual Property Rights" or "IPR" means any and all intellectual property rights existing anywhere in the world associated with any and all (i) Patents, (ii) Trademarks, (iii) Copyrights, (iv) Domain Names, (v) rights in Technology, (vi) rights in Trade Secrets, (vii) rights in Data, (viii) all tangible embodiments of the foregoing in whatever form or medium and (ix) any other legal protections and rights related to any of the foregoing. "Intellectual Property Rights" may include contractual rights (including license grants from third parties) if explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition explicitly excludes contractual rights. The modified definition introduces an exception, stating that contractual rights can be included if both parties agree in writing. This contradicts the original definition and creates uncertainty regarding the scope of Intellectual Property Rights, potentially leading to disputes about whether specific contractual rights are covered.

Section 3.01. License Grants.

(a) Patents. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, as of the Distribution Date, Nuance hereby grants to SpinCo and the members of the SpinCo Group a worldwide, non-exclusive, fully paid-up, perpetual and irrevocable, transferable (subject to ARTICLE VIII), sublicensable (subject to Section 3.01(g)) license under the Nuance Patents, solely to the extent that claims of the Nuance Patents cover products or services of the SpinCo Business in the SpinCo Field of Use, together with natural extensions and evolutions thereof, in each case to make, have made, use, sell, offer for sale, import and otherwise exploit such products and services, together with natural extensions and evolutions thereof.
perturbation.changed_text:

perturbation.explanation: The original text states the license is 'fully paid-up, perpetual and irrevocable, transferable'. The modified text removes 'fully paid-up' and introduces uncertainty by stating 'The duration and transferability of this license will be determined on a yearly basis and is subject to renegotiation.' This directly contradicts the original clause and undermines the certainty of the license granted, creating uncertainty about its long-term validity.

perturbation.original_text: Section 8.01. No Assignment or Transfer Without Consent. Except as expressly set forth in this Agreement, neither this Agreement nor any of the rights, interests or obligations under this Agreement, including the licenses granted pursuant to this Agreement, shall be assigned, in whole or in part, by operation of Law or otherwise by either Party without the prior written consent of the other Party. Any purported assignment without such consent shall be void.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 8.01. No Assignment or Transfer Without Consent. Except as expressly set forth in this Agreement, neither this Agreement nor any of the rights, interests or obligations under this Agreement, including the licenses granted pursuant to this Agreement, shall be assigned, in whole or in part, by operation of Law or otherwise by either Party without the prior written consent of the other Party. Any purported assignment without such consent shall be void. However, in situations deemed necessary by the assigning party, assignments can be made without consent, provided the assigning party notifies the other party within 30 days of the assignment.
perturbation.explanation: The original text strictly prohibits assignment without prior written consent. The modified text introduces a loophole, allowing assignments without consent if the assigning party deems it necessary, as long as they provide notification within 30 days. This directly contradicts the initial prohibition and makes the requirement for consent uncertain, leading to potential disputes about the validity of assignments made without consent.
